website_summaries.verdict: A charming little snail with a removable shape sorter for a shell. Two-in-one design grows with little ones and is suitable for a variety of age groups, ranging from 12 months to 4 years.
pros: Shape sorter shell rolls when the snail is pulled, creating an interesting visual and auditory effect
Snail and shell can be used separately
Protruding soft-touch eyes seem to enthrall younger babies
Tail moves from side to side
Appeals to tiny tots and older children
Solid wood construction is durable enough to withstand years of use
cons: Getting the shell onto the body correctly can be somewhat tricky for little hands

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, well-made toy that engages kids in different ways as they grow
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew for Christmas last year. He absolutely adores it and plays with it all the time. When he was younger, he enjoyed pushing the snail around and making the tail wag, and rolling the shell on the floor (with the blocks inside, it makes a very loud, satisfying 'clack-clack-clack' as it rolls). Now he is fully engaged in the matching game aspect. I suspect the next stage is using it as a pull toy on his toddler adventures around the house. I was also very impressed with the build quality of this toy. The fit and finish are excellent and the wood is high-quality with no rough edges. The colors are bright and attractive.
customer_reviews.author: johnnydc

customer_reviews.title: Broken tail
customer_reviews.text: Our snail's tail broke in half after normal usage. We opt for wooden toys because they will last longer than the plastic toys. Unfortunately with this high quality wooden toy, it did not last more than a year with infrequent usage. I contacted customer service, and they offered a replacement at 50% off suggested retail (plus shipping). That's not worth it. We thought we had gotten a nice toy all of our children could play with, but it did not even make it past the first child.
customer_reviews.author: L.S.

customer_reviews.title: Adored
customer_reviews.text: My little man, 14 months, loves this toy. Snail shell He will play with the snail's shell placing the shaped blocks through the holes. He has also figured out how to put other objects through the back. He will walk around carrying the shell and shaking it for the noises it makes. This is easily grasped by little hands. Snail body The string is perfect. He loves to take the body for walks, most of the time without the shell. The eyes are also super fun to play with. So glad I bought this interactive toy.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi M. Sundalius

customer_reviews.title: Peeling pain not safe
customer_reviews.text: Want to like this toy but questioning quality of paint. My child was sucking on one of the eyes and paint started peeling. Not safe for kids that are still sucking on toys. Made in China quality. I’m returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Julz

customer_reviews.title: My daughter never warmed up to it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality product but I think it’s just too much going on for a young child. It’s too busy, the pulling the shape sorting...it was never a popular toy with my kid. Even the pulling part isn’t great.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuelle  Brezault

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for my 11 month old. I like that the shapes are very basic and easy for him to hold. He is not walking yet so we aren't really using it to its fullest yet. I also like that when you pull it the blocks make noise as the shell turns.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Adorable classic wood toy
customer_reviews.text: We got this toy for our eight month old daughter for Christmas and she immediately loved it! She can't pull it quite yet, but can play with the shape shorter since it easily detaches. The wooden shapes can easily be accessed from the opposite side, which has a spandex strap that holds the shapes in. I am looking forward to her walking and being able to pull this snail around the house. The body of the snail makes fun noises as it rolls!
customer_reviews.author: amanzo4jc

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 17 month granddaughter. A little advanced at the moment but she enjoyed trying to get the blocks into the openings. Right now, it requires us to be with her and teach her how to play with this but she did enjoy it. She enjoys reaching in the back and pulling the blocks out too. The container has grooves to fit on the snail's back and stays on pretty well even with some jerky pulling. She'll grow into this and overall I think this is a good toy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: shape sorter and pull toy
customer_reviews.text: this was a winner in our house. My grandson loves the shapes and shape sorter plus he likes to pull it behind him now that he is walking. All wood, beautifully done and just enough shapes so that it is not overwhelming. I recommend this to any one looking for an educational toy that appeals to children as young as 8 months until possibly 24 months. I strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: rghersh

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, great, GREAT toy for kids 4m-4yrs+
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome toy for 4m+... Our daughter enjoyed following it as Daddy pulled it in a circle around her. Next, she'll be able to play with blocks and then put them in the holes. The round top rolls on its own and makes noise when the blocks are inside. The tail goes up and down as the snail rolls, and all is beautifully colored wood except the eyes, the "stems" of which appear to be a latex rubber- which we like because they bob a little.
customer_reviews.author: Beagle Lovers

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Toy
customer_reviews.text: My grand-daughter loves this toy. It is perfect for a beginner walker to pull around; the colors, noise, and movement are fascinating for little ones. The top pieces are removable and little hands will find many ways to play with and create with them. Pull toys have been around a long time, and there is a reason for that. It is very satisfying for littles to walk with something behind them that they are in charge of!
customer_reviews.author: carolyn Orne

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fun!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is very well made and can be played with in a number of ways. The circular "back" of the snail rotates when the snail is walking causing the shapes inside to tumble and make noise. The back can also come off the snail to use as a sorter. I did tie a small teething clip to the string to make it easier for little hands to hold while walking the snail. Our 15 month old grandson loves to take his snail for a walk!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy for child development
customer_reviews.text: We play catch-up around the house with this toy. It is cool, noisy and has not bothered the child for several months of use. The quality is high!
customer_reviews.author: Lyna

customer_reviews.title: The two pieces though awesome are rarely played with together
customer_reviews.text: My girls play with the pull snail more without the back and the shape shorter back more without the pull snail. The two pieces though awesome are rarely played with together. It definitely gets played with, but didn't have the fan fair with my girls that I was hoping for. It is also fairly loud in a kid friendly way but too loud when others are taking naps.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Educational and Fun
customer_reviews.text: This toy was a huge hit with the one-year-old I gave it to for a birthday present. He was able to play with it before he could really walk and loved the bright colors and the smooth feel of the wood pieces. Now that he's walking, he loves to pull it along and he's beginning to try to fit the pieces into their correspondingly shaped holes. A great all-around toy for a developing child.
customer_reviews.author: Mamazabakaka

customer_reviews.title: Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 14 month granddaughter but as smart as she is...It's difficult for her to replace the balancing wheel. In addition, the pulling string does NOT have anything for her to keep string from slipping (like a wooden ball)
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: First Pull Toy
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well made. Grandson is 1 1/2 and he immediately took the string and took off. He loves putting shapes in big hole--guess he will learn to sort as he grows. This is well made and probably will be a toy he will have for his children. not plastic junk.
customer_reviews.author: Gena

customer_reviews.title: Baby approved
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old daughter loves it! She would craw after the snail all day long. Happy baby happy mommy
customer_reviews.author: Lei Tong

customer_reviews.title: Wheels do not roll freely going forward
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this a while ago and just opened it since our son was old enough to enjoy it. Unfortunately the wheels on the snail bind up and make a slight screeching noise when you pull the string and do not roll at all. It seems to roll okay for short distances when you push it from the front to go in reverse. Since it is designed to be pulled from the front, it basically does not do it's primary function. Disappointed I bought this and am so glad I didn't give it as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My 17 month boy loved it out of the box. He enjoyed walking around with the snail and banging it from time to time. It was so sturdy and good quality. It hasn't broken yet. Knock on wood. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SimonAndSally

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: This is an adorable toy, my 9 month old nephew moved his mothers phone out of the way to play with this!
customer_reviews.author: C. Reida

customer_reviews.title: A favorite first birthday option
customer_reviews.text: So much to love about this wooden toy! The round shape sorter twirls delightfully when the snail is pulled creating a satisfying wooden rumble, the eyes bobbity about eliciting many giggles it's going audience, and if all comes apart to create mout multiple playing options.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I anticipate many months of enjoyment out of this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 month old, even though she's too young to match the shapes or pull the toy. Right away she started playing with the bouncy eyes and hitting the blocks against the snail's back. It's been two months and so far she hasn't tired of it. Now she likes to put the blocks in the back side (not the side with the cut outs). I anticipate my baby getting many more months (and maybe years) of enjoyment out of this toy.
customer_reviews.author: PlumPerch

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Perfect toy for ages 6 months -2 years!! Super durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and my son loves to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: viktar shauchuk

customer_reviews.title: Best wood pull toy! Multipurpose for lots of cute fun!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely makes sense that this is such a highly acclaimed toy. It can be used in multiple ways. They can roll the round part on its own. It’s neat how it turn opposite as its being pulled. They can play with putting the wood shapes in. It’s wood!!! It’s super cute, the eyes are fun and they can pull it around!!! Def best wood pull toy around!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lovely, well made toy
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves the walk-a-long snail. For her it is "cargo", short for the French "escargot". It is well designed and well made. What you learn to expect from Hape. The only reason I am giving this only four stars, it came with two blue triangles and is missing the yellow rectangle. A packaging mistake for sure, but it is frustrating for the little one never to have a brick which is going into the square whole.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Really great for little hands to learn some dexterity.
customer_reviews.text: Totally adorable and my 1 year old loves it. Puts the blocks in the holes, asks me to get them out again to put them back in. Its very cute the way it pulls behind them, too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pudas

customer_reviews.title: My one year old likes this toy...
customer_reviews.text: My one year old daughter likes playing with this toy. It is one of the toys she plays with frequently. She is in the push and pull stage so she does like pulling it along and watching the wheel turn. She does like to put the blocks in her mouth but I am not worried about that as her dad or I are with her when she plays. Dislikes: None
customer_reviews.author: kburshiem

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: My grandson, 1 year old, loves this and plays with it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Great quality toy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality toy! My son likes to play with each part separately at this point since he's not walking but loves this. So far we've loved everything Hape that we've bought! We might even get him the large activity center cube for Christmas but since we live in a city not sure about the size. All the smaller wooden toys I've bought are great size and have multifunctional play.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Looking for the perfect 1 year old gift?
customer_reviews.text: Best birthday gift for 1 year old! So many levels of enjoyment! Shape sorter, roll it across floor, pull it along, push it, or just watch it go round and round with the cute tail moving up and down. It's her go to toy and visiting children are drawn to it too. Best and most played with gift of everything!
customer_reviews.author: M. G.

customer_reviews.title: Super cute toy
customer_reviews.text: Super cute toy. My toddler loves chasing it around the room as I pull it. I love that it's both a shape sorter and a pull toy. The string is a bit long for a young baby, I would say. I'm surprised at this, but I do love everything else about it.
customer_reviews.author: echo

customer_reviews.title: Such a cute toy!
customer_reviews.text: We have used the snail daily for the past six months. It’s a versatile toy and seems high quality. Definitely one of my better purchases!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Completely happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality and was so happy to give it as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna N.

customer_reviews.title: The parents thought it was great, the kiddo was still playing with wrapping paper ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a friend's 1 year old daughter. The parents thought it was great, the kiddo was still playing with wrapping paper when I left but I expect she enjoyed it later on. It was a nice looking gift, 2 toys in one, and it was a good price. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, but beware of splitting wood
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy, but want to give a heads up to keep an eye out for splitting wood. One of the two we've purchased splintered and fell apart upon removing from packaging. See photo. We keep a close eye on the one we have now. Still a winner with close supervision.
customer_reviews.author: kjgolds

customer_reviews.title: Wooden toy for hipster Moms
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a cool wooden toy to make me seem new age. No, Honestly, I really like this toy. My daughter uses it correctly and it makes me feel like she's (ahead) but it's really just a cool toy that is multifunctional.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Best quality
customer_reviews.text: The best! My son loves it! So cute and nice.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Great for teething.
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves to roll the wheel. And chew on the snail. Win win.
customer_reviews.author: ARH

customer_reviews.title: the Walk-A-Long Snail is a favorite of our granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: A high-quality, non-toxic toy, the Walk-A-Long Snail is a favorite of our granddaughter. From 6-12 months of age, she played with the circular portion and shapes. Then, when she learned to walk, she enjoyed it as a pull toy. Now, at 15 months, she asks for it to be tied to her scooter bike (also by Hape) so she can pull it along behind her.
customer_reviews.author: m4mall

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy...Bigger than I Expected.
customer_reviews.text: My 12 month old son likes this toy. It is not his favorite but it is a good toy. Very study and hard; well made. I have to watch him with it because if he throws it or drops it on himself he would be hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Sol T

customer_reviews.title: So clever for a walk behind toy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool - the shell spins as you walk with it. The eyes are googly and wobble around. Also, the elastic band over the hole is so much kinder on fingers retrieving sorted shapes than with other toys (I'm looking at you, Tupperware Shape-o ball!) It's completely adorable.
customer_reviews.author: M Geyer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for babies
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old son loves this little snail. He can't yet put the shapes in the right spots, but he loves pulling it to him and rattling the "shell." We had a 3 1/2 year old over and he loved it too, so seems like it should keep my son entertained for a while. I also love that it is made of wood instead of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fred

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My 18 no old loves this! Sooo cute and loves to pull it around and hear the rattle
customer_reviews.author: Erv

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My kids all love this toy. Simple toy but lots of activities such as a pull along, shape sorter, wheel to chase and it's so cute how as you pull it, the wheel spins. Made out of wood instead of cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Starks

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best toy I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best toy I have ever purchased. She is under 12 mo this but the individual pieces keep her occupied for over 30 minutes. Sometime she just flicks the eye balls for 20! Well constructed and versatile
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three toys in one - great gift
customer_reviews.text: I really love this toy and have gifted it several times. It's three toys in one - a shape sorter, a walking toy, and a rattle. Plus its colorful and well designed. My daughter enjoys playing with it - especially as a shape sorter.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Welch

customer_reviews.title: It's great as a pull toy and as a shape sorter
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month old loves this toy! It's great as a pull toy and as a shape sorter. This would make a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Great price. This toy is exceptional and a big hit with my kids. Hape is such a good quality brand. Snail was bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Smurfettegirl

customer_reviews.title: The Eyes were Scary, but the Rest was Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my niece when she was about 7 months old. At first, the snails eye's made her very angry, and she would scream at them and try to rip them off. (Why? Who knows.) However, she loved the shell and putting the shapes in place. She also loved chewing the shapes, which are much too large to be dangerous to a child. Once she was over a year old, she came to terms with the eyes and started to pull the base around the house. She still loved putting the shapes in place. She also likes to attempt to say the colors and shapes. This is a great toy for teaching fine motor skills, colors, and shapes.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Laura

customer_reviews.title: So cute!
customer_reviews.text: So cute and lots to explore. My 11 month old has a great time with her snail friend.
customer_reviews.author: Fritzi

customer_reviews.title: Cute and well made
customer_reviews.text: Such a cute toy! I love this brand- all of their toys are sturdy, colorful, well made, and use paint that is safe for kids. The details on this snail are so cute. The snail's shell is removable and the shapes are easy to get in and out. It also rolls very easily. Such a cute toy for a little one!
customer_reviews.author: Rkd

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old loves this toy and gave it as a gift. Great learning toy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as it looks
customer_reviews.text: This is very cute. Just as it looks in the pictures. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: kcgirl

customer_reviews.title: well made, good investment
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old was instantly drawn to this the minute we pulled it out if the box. She loves the bouncy eyes and we love that it will grow with her. It's a well made toy, happy to have it for her.
customer_reviews.author: E.wild

customer_reviews.title: My 10.5 month grandson loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely, beautifully made toy with oodles of developmental features. You can pull it along. You can take the shape-sorter toy off the snail's back and play with it separately. Very good purchase. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ex-Pat Brit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is adorable! i love that it is multifunctional. My boys use it as a shape sorter. Roll the removable she'll. Shake it like a mara a (it makes a great noise when the shapes are inside), wiggle the Google eyes and pull along the snail. It is also great quality. I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for many ages!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cousin’s first birthday. He loves it! He is not yet pulling it but his 3 year old brother does. The one year old loves to take the shapes out and put them back in... over and over again :)
customer_reviews.author: Emily Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old LOVES this toy. She can sit and do the shapes over and over and loves that she can pull the snail along when she walks. Definitely her favorite toy and I love it because it's multiple toys in one and a great learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: SFGiants

customer_reviews.title: Didn't realize it would be such a hit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two year old nephew, and my 16-month old likes it better than most of his own Christmas gifts! It's a great toy for a wide range of ages.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for toddler
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect gift for my friends 1year old son. He loved taking the wheel off the top of the snail and enjoyed pulling it around the room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy. I love that it's wood. The ball spins around as he pulls it around the living room and the blocks inside clank around inside. Easy to get the blocks out for him, but they don't fall out while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome toy! Bought for my 10 month old (a little young for it) but she still loves to play with it. It will definitely grow with her.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a first birthday. The kiddo loves it! His mom says he pulls it around the house all of the time and tries to do the shapes too! It's super cute and sturdy. Hape is the best toy brand in my opinion. I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Soden

customer_reviews.title: Quality Toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cousin's 1 year old son on his birthday. The eyes are the best part as they flex and move as the snail goes. Both the birthday boy and the rest of the children there were very interested in it, and it appears to be solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: it is adorable!
customer_reviews.text: So cute! Only reason not a five star is that it is a bit loud when pulling. Have to take the wooden pieces out when moving. Otherwise, it is adorable!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hannah

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: OMG! What a great, quality toy. I love the well made wooden toys and this is at the top of my list. I would highly recommend this toy to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: TDPaul

customer_reviews.title: A good choice
customer_reviews.text: My one year old grandson loves the snail and putting the shapes into the holes. It seems well made and sturdy. I wanted something he could pull behind him as he had just began to walk. the string is too short but it's probably a safety thing.
customer_reviews.author: PENNY N

customer_reviews.title: Great wooden pull toy
customer_reviews.text: Great wooden toy. Love that the "shell" comes off, made it easier for my 1 yr old nephew to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Yegoiants

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand! Quality product, quality materials, and baby loves it too. I think this is one she'll "grow" with.
customer_reviews.author: marzipan

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a pull toy for a small child
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a pull toy for a small child. The back of the snail is removable and not easily replaced nor does it stay on very well while being pulled.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Van Buskirk

customer_reviews.title: My daughter plays with both pieces separately and seems to enjoy it, especially putting the different shapes in and ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy, quality made. The toy has two major pieces- the snail "shell" is not attached to the rest. Hard to keep it in place for my daughter (who is only 15 months) because if the toy tips or gets bumped, it falls off. My daughter plays with both pieces separately and seems to enjoy it, especially putting the different shapes in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Lane

customer_reviews.title: Best quality wood game for my baby
customer_reviews.text: The product looks even better when I received it. Great fun to play with. Very good size and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Y. H.

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a first birthday gift for my son and it has been a huge hit! Most of the time he plays with the shape-sorting shell separately from the snail. Almost six months later and it still gets pulled all around the house. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great Classic Toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my niece’s first birthday and she loved it! It’s well-made and solid. Such a classic toy.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Cute and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: The fun is in putting bells and trinkets into the snail for walking. Cute and sturdy. Arrived quickly and well packed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda wg

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 1 year old nephew and he loves it. The wheel comes off of the snail and can roll around on its own which makes it multiple toys in one. It is good quality and nice that it is wooden and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Cpiper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift. As of this writing, recipient is thrilled with product. If that changes, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and fun
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and fun. It is great as a shape sorter for pre-walkers and then as a pull toy for walkers. I like that it's not toxic and so I dont need to worry if parts go into his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 12 month old's favorite toy. She's had it for a few months and still loves it. She adores trailing the snail behind her and playing with the sorter separately. I also use the shell to store her other Hape shapes. It's cute and fun!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G.

customer_reviews.title: super nice toy
customer_reviews.text: amazing toy for a very fair price - many things to keep your child's attention. LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie O. Siemer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's like a 2-in 1 toy. We like the pull toy as well as the shape sorter.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany J.

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler toy
customer_reviews.text: Grand-daughter loves it! Well built with well sanded edges and bright paint. Glad I made this purchase for her birthday!
customer_reviews.author: DianeH

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy.
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves this toy, it's not only fun for him but teaches him as well and works on his motor skills. The toy is made well and can handle a thrashing, that I know he will administer to it.
customer_reviews.author: dre

customer_reviews.title: My 13 month old son pulls this snail around all ...
customer_reviews.text: My 13 month old son pulls this snail around all day long. He hasn't quite figured out the shape sorter but he likes playing with the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Chelsea Zastrow

customer_reviews.title: Great toy. My 1 year old grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. My 1 year old grandson loves it. He can put in the circle piece, and walk the snail. Still working on the square and triangle.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: My grandbabies ages 1 to 4 all play with this ...
customer_reviews.text: My grandbabies ages 1 to 4 all play with this and claim it as there snail when they visit. Well made, well thought out toy.

customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful pull toy! The shape-sorting feature is a nice bonus. It makes a lot of noise as the child pulls it, which is very entertaining for my son. It's also extremely cute.

product_meta.title: Award Winning Hape Walk-A-Long Snail Toddler Wooden Pull Toy
product_meta.description:
Hape's Walk-A-Long Snail Toddler Wooden Pull Toy is the perfect companion for little ones just beginning to learn about sorting colors and shapes.

This multi-tasking snail tows a shell full of wooden blocks as he tags along behind you, waving his tail. Kids ages 12 months to kids of 5 years can lighten the load by removing the colorful shape sorter, and getting him ready to roll alone.

The push-pull toy has three differently shaped holes (triangle, circle, and square). The opposite side features an elastic-banded opening for easy yet secure access to the inside the snail’s shell.

Develop Your Child's Motor Skills

The Walk-A-Along Snail encourages movement and problem-solving. The wooden push toy encourages children to develop fine motor skills and play actively as they take their new snail friend on adventures around the house.

The shape sort toys help your little one develop color and shape recognition as they try to full up the snail’s shell.

Wooden Snail Pull Toy Material and Finishes

The push pull toy is made from sturdy and durable wood sourced from environmentally sustainable forests. This snail toy is finished with non-toxic water paint, decorated with bright colors and shapes for your child to enjoy.

Hape toys stimulate children through every stage of development and help nurture and develop their natural abilities.

All Hape products sold in North America meet or exceed all applicable safety standards.

Award Winning Product

 * 2013 Play Advances Language Award
 * 2014 Parent’s Choice Recommended Award



BRAND STORY
By Hape
feature_bullets: LEARNING AND EXPLORING COMPANION: Perfect tagalong push or pull toy for your little one as they gain confidence in learning and exploring

REMOVABLE SHAPE SORTER SHELL: Bright and colourful toddler toy. The shell features three differently shapes holes for toddlers to practice shape sorting on one side and an elastic-banded opening on the other. Sorter comes with a blue triangle, red cylinder and yellow square
SAFE TO PLAY WITH: Durable and sturdy wood toddler toy, contains water-based paint and has non-toxic finishes
AWARD WINNING: The winner of the 2013 Play Advances Language Award and the 2014 Parent’s Choice Recommended Award
Perfect tagalong companion for little ones as they gain confidence in learning and exploring
Convenient pull string is long enough to pull easily behind as sorted blocks spin
Bright and colorful, the shell features three differently shapes holes for toddlers to practice shape sorting
Hape finishes are all non-toxic, child safe and of the highest quality
Recommended for children ages 12 months – 4 years
